data.name: Bob the teacher
data.description:
Bob is a very busy teacher and it's time to finalize the grades. He already has the names and grades of his students and, being a fan of exploration, he wants to store them **in a map**.

Bob only wants to create a list of students who **have passed** his subject. **(Passing means getting a score between 5 and 10, inclusive)**.

In the provided lists, **the names will always be valid values** and for simplicity, the **grades are integer values**.

**IMPORTANT**, if a student's name appears more than once, only the first occurrence will be stored in the map.

Here is an example:

```
names = {"Alice", "Bob", "Charlie", "Diana"}, grades = {5, 12, 7, 3} -> {"Alice" -> 5, "Charlie" -> 7}
```
